CatDescriptText: Mrs. Helen Watson, 6532 Deary Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 7, 1958, pg. 3 with question: �Do you think adults in the community are doing enough to foster constructive recreational activities, like playgrounds, centers, places to dance, Little Leagues, etc., for youth?� answer reads: "I don't think so. To my notion, we need more recreation centers and the greatest need is in Homewood and East Liberty because the Hill District is being depopulated and our children are being moved with their families into these precincts in East Liberty and Homewood."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Helen Watson, wearing dark suit, light colored blouse with ruffles, and light colored hat, holding basket handbag with flowers over left arm, standing to the left of man wearing archery scene necktie, standing in front of block wall
